Itâ€™s another one of those times that a sequel outshines the original, and is one the must-plays of the video game medium overall. Even years after release this game is a bunch of fun, and the storyline and humour still hold up. It's fun to pick up for a playthrough every now and then, and even when you already know the trick to each room. Itâ€™s also a plus that it doesnâ€™t take that long to do, especially when youâ€™re watching people clip all over the map during speedruns, which never gets old.

$22 CAD can seem a bit much for a game that's almost 7 years old at the time of writing, but it goes on sale regularly, and even for full price you can get a [i]lot[/i] of fun out of this. It is an all-time classic, which will remain likely remain relevant to gaming indefinitely. It is an especially great example of a game that is all thriller, no filler; it sets up mechanics, and then plays around with them and doesnâ€™t overstay its welcome by getting repetitive, even on repeat plays. (Look through the reviews: for a game that can be completed in well under 10 hours, most people spend a [i]lot[/i] more time with it, and not because they got stuck.)

By far my favourite game, great story and amazing concept. recommend the first game efore starting, for understanding purposes. Fo people who like to be challenged its amazing ad i recomentd 100% to try, test and create custom test chambers.

It's funny, it's fun, it's way more than I had expected it to be. A great example of a sequel being done right! 
It builds on Portal's mechanics by adding entirely new, complementary mechanics and making the most of the dystopian sci-fi aesthetic and the satirical dialogue. 
The soundtrack is stupendeous too!

The campaign isn't long (I finished it in 15 hours), but it's worth it! 

Unfortunately, I had bought this game late (like oh-so-many games in my library -_-), so finding co-op partners online has proven to be pretty difficult. I was once partnered up with a random girl from Portugal who sounded like she was about 13, and she couldn't get past the lobby. Oh dear. 
So I put the game down for now, until I can find somebody within my timezone who also wants to play Portal 2 co-op. I think one's best bet is to go to Reddit or some gaming forum/community and asking around. This is really really unfortunate, because co-op is really good in this game!

Still, the single-player campaign is very strong. It's better than Portal in my opinion, which is saying a lot! 
Even today, over ten years after Portal was released, and seven after its sequel, both games haven't aged at all, and feel as fresh as ever! :D

PS: I'd get this on sale unless you absolutely know a friend or two who'll play this co-op with you, otherwise 20 Eur (over German Steam) is a tad pricey for such an old game with only a 15-hour single-player campaign.

jugazo
Ã‰ um jogo interessante para quem gosta de puzzles e desafios. Eu particulamente gosto, mas vai do gosto de cada um

A good sequel to the amazing first portal.
Is longer, funnier, with coop maps and an overall great and polished game.
It has some bad sides though:
First of all is still quite short. Without coop maps it took me around 5/6 hours to see the ending screen. Some puzzle rooms are clearly filler and in the whole game there isnt one very hard challenge. Arguably the first one was far more challenging. 
There are too many loading screen between puzzle rooms. That would be fine if puzzles were harder but if you breeze through them you'll stare at loading screens more then playing. 

But still a wonderful game.
Great attention was put in the art design and in the writing. Both GladOS and Wheatly are fun and with a great personality. So is an enjoyable experience.
Really great game. A fantastic sequel!
I've played it co-op with a friend and we had a blast! Don't play it without a microphone.

VERY GOOD GAME!! The only reason I bought it was that it was on sale at the time, I didn't even know this existed (only knew about Portal 1). Once I finished the first Portal, I continued on to the second and was glad I did! Good game, definitely worth buying!
Definitely a good game.

Incredible!

The puzzles mixed with comedy and story all put together is this game its amaizing and thats just the singleplayer

There is an entirely different game for co-op inside of this and Workshop support what more can you want
excelente historia lpm, y el modo cooperativo multijugador tambien excelente nada que reprocharle a este juegazo
Kozak gierka :)!!!!
